DataListSpec.Name: Child Quota Waiting List Process Exception Data List
DataListSpec.Description: List of kids that were put on the waiting list and lock exceptions for a particular instance of the business process
DataListSpec.Author: Cary Mayeda

SPDataList.common:CreateProcedureSQL:
create procedure dbo.USR_USP_DATALIST_CHIDLQUOTAWAITINGLISTPROCESSS_STATUSREPORT_EXCEPTIONS (@contextID uniqueidentifier) as begin if @contextID is null return 1
declare @tablePrefix nvarchar(255) = 'dbo.USR_CHILDQUOTA_WAITINGLISTPROCESS_EXCEPTION_' -- This is the name of part of the success table name created by the business process (without the guid) declare @tableGUIDString nvarchar(50) = replace (convert (nvarchar(50),@contextID), '-', '_') -- Convert the guid to have underscores instead of dashes
declare @selectExceptionSQL as nvarchar(max) set @selectExceptionSQL = 'select CHILDPROJECTID, COUNTRYID, SPONSORSHIPOPPORTUNITYCHILDID, ERRORMESSAGE ' + ' from ' + @tablePrefix + @tableGUIDString
-- ** Had to use a temp table because there were permission issues selecting from SPONSORSHIPREASON when run in dynamic sql exec. create table #childQuotaProcessExceptions(childProjectID uniqueidentifier, countryID uniqueidentifier, childID uniqueidentifier, errorMessage uniqueidentifier) insert into #childQuotaProcessExceptions exec (@selectExceptionSQL)
select countryc.LOOKUPID as CountryID, countryc.NAME as CountryName, projectc.LOOKUPID as ProjectID, projectc.NAME as ProjectName, childc.LOOKUPID as ChildID, childc.NAME as ChildName, sreason.REASON as WaitingListReason
from #childQuotaProcessExceptions cq
inner join dbo.CONSTITUENT childc on cq.childID = childc.ID inner join dbo.SPONSORSHIPREASON sreason on cq.errorMessage = sreason.ID left join dbo.CONSTITUENT projectc on cq.childProjectID = projectc.ID left join dbo.CONSTITUENT countryc on cq.countryID = countryc.ID
order by CountryID, ProjectID, ChildID
end
